data.enText: get rid of

data.chText: （尤指在不合适的地方）丢弃，扔掉，倾倒
data.enText: to get rid of sth you do not want, especially in a place which is not suitable

data.chText: 太多的有毒废料在向大海里倾倒。
data.enText: Too much toxic waste is being dumped at sea.
The dead body was just dumped by the roadside.
to get rid of sb/sth or leave them for sb else to deal with

data.chText: 他没有权利总是把他的问题推到我身上。
data.enText: He's got no right to keep dumping his problems on me.
to get rid of goods by selling them at a very low price, often in another country
put down
to put sth down in a careless or untidy way

data.chText: 就把你的东西堆在那儿吧——我们以后再整理。
data.enText: Just dump your stuff over there─we'll sort it out later.
end relationship
to end a romantic relationship with sb

data.chText: 他已把女朋友给甩了，你听说了吗？
data.enText: Did you hear he's dumped his girlfriend?
computing
to copy information and move it somewhere to store it
drop/dump sth in sb's lap
to make sth the responsibility of another person

data.chText: 他们把问题断然给我推了回来。
data.enText: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.
dump on sb
to criticize sb severely or treat them badly
for waste
a place where waste or rubbish/garbage is taken and left
a rubbish dump
a garbage dump
the municipal dump
a toxic/nuclear waste dump
mine dump
a hill that is formed when waste sand from the production of gold is piled in one place over a period of time
dirty place

data.chText: 脏地方；邋遢场所；令人讨厌的地方
data.enText: a dirty or unpleasant place

data.chText: 你怎么会住在这种肮脏地方？
data.enText: How can you live in this dump?
for weapons
a temporary store for military supplies
an ammunition dump
computing
an act of copying data stored in a computer; a copy or list of the contents of this data
waste from body
an act of passing waste matter from the body through the bowels
to have a dump
drop/dump sth in sb's lap
to make sth the responsibility of another person

data.chText: 他们把问题断然给我推了回来。
data.enText: They dropped the problem firmly back in my lap.
dump on sb
to criticize sb severely or treat them badly

tr: a place where supplies can be stored
(computer science) a copy of the contents of a computer storage device
a piece of land where waste materials are dumped

example: It plunged to the bottom of the well

tr: drop (stuff) in a heap or mass
example: The truck dumped the garbage in the street

tr: sever all ties with, usually unceremoniously or irresponsibly
example: The company dumped him after many years of service
She dumped her boyfriend when she fell in love with a rich man

value.def: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

example.ex: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried towards the market...
example.tran: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德酒店后就匆匆赶往集市。

example.ex: He got my haversack from the cab and dumped it at my feet.
example.tran: 他把我的背包从出租车上取来丢到我脚下。

value.def: If something is dumped somewhere, it is put or left there because it is no longer wanted or needed.

example.ex: The getaway car was dumped near a motorway tunnel...
example.tran: 逃亡用的车被丢弃在高速公路隧道附近。

example.ex: A million tonnes of untreated sewage is dumped into the sea...
example.tran: 一百万吨未经处理的污水被倾倒进了海里。

example.ex: The government declared that it did not dump radioactive waste at sea.
example.tran: 政府宣称并未将放射性废料倾倒在海里。

example.ex: German law forbids the dumping of hazardous waste on German soil.
example.tran: 德国法律禁止在德国本土倾倒有害废料。

value.def: A dump is a place where rubbish is left, for example on open ground outside a town.

example.ex: ...companies that bring their rubbish straight to the dump...
example.tran: 将其废弃物直接运送至垃圾场的公司

example.ex: The walled garden was used as a dump.
example.tran: 带围墙的花园被用作了垃圾场。

value.def: If you say that a place is a dump, you think it is ugly and unpleasant to live in or visit.

example.ex: 'What a dump!' Christabel said, standing in the doorway of the youth hostel.
example.tran: “真够脏乱的！”克丽丝特布尔站在青年旅社的门口说道。

value.tran: 肮脏的地方;乱七八糟的地方

value.def: A dump is a place where an army stores food and weapons temporarily while it is stationed in a particular place.
value.tran: (军队中粮食、武器等的)临时堆积处,临时仓库

value.def: To dump something such as an idea, policy, or practice means to stop supporting or using it.

example.ex: Ministers believed it was vital to dump the poll tax before the election.
example.tran: 大臣们认为在大选前停止征收人头税至关重要。

value.tran: 不再支持,摒弃(政策、想法等)

value.def: If a firm or company dumps goods, it sells large quantities of them at prices far below their real value, usually in another country, in order to gain a bigger market share or to keep prices high in the home market.

example.ex: It produces more than it needs, then dumps its surplus onto the world market.
example.tran: 当产量超过需求时,过剩的产品便倾销到世界市场。

value.tran: (通常指为占领海外市场)倾销,抛售

value.def: If you dump someone, you end your relationship with them.

example.ex: I thought he was going to dump me for another girl...
example.tran: 我以为他要为了另一个女孩而和我分手。

example.ex: She was dumped by her long-term lover after five years...
example.tran: 5 年后她被相恋多年的恋人抛弃了。

example.ex: I suggested that we not only dump the two companies, but that we also should ditch any other business not involved in soft drinks.
example.tran: 我提议我们不仅要和那两个公司断绝关系，还要抛弃其他任何不涉及软饮料的业务。

value.tran: 与…断绝关系;与…结束关系

value.def: If you say that a parent dumps a child with someone, you are criticizing the parent for leaving the child to be looked after by that person.

example.ex: I was sometimes dumped with my grandmother or left with highly unsuitable au pairs...
example.tran: 有时我被扔给奶奶照看，或者被交给毫无经验的临时保姆。

example.ex: He can't cope and dumps his two teenage boys on them to be looked after.
example.tran: 他应付不过来，只能将他那两个十来岁的儿子交给他们代为照看。

value.def: To dump computer data or memory means to copy it from one storage system onto another, such as from disk to magnetic tape.

example.ex: It can take a couple of hours to dump a thousand telephone numbers into a 128k EPROM pack...
example.tran: 将 1,000 个电话号码转存到一个128k的EPROM芯片要花好几个小时。

example.ex: All the data is then dumped into the main computer.
example.tran: 所有数据随后被转存至主计算机。

value.def: A dump is a list of the data that is stored in a computer's memory at a particular time. Dumps are often used by computer programmers to find out what is causing a problem with a program.

example.ex: ...a screen dump.
example.tran: 屏幕转储

value.tran: 转存信息库;转储数据库

value.def: If someone dumps on you, they treat you very badly and unfairly.

example.ex: He was a nice guy, Mona. He didn't dump on me.
example.tran: 莫娜,他是个不错的家伙,没有亏待我。

value.def: If you are down in the dumps, you are feeling very depressed and miserable.

example.ex: She's feeling a bit down in the dumps and needs cheering up.
example.tran: 她情绪有点低落，需要振奋起来。

value.tran: 郁闷的;沮丧的;闷闷不乐的

trans: (计算机)屏幕转存，屏幕复制，屏幕打印
